traceability.evidence: 1) src/cli-options.js: parseProdMinAgeFlag and parseDevMinAgeFlag consume --prod-min-age/--dev-min-age flags, and parseProdSeverityFlag/parseDevSeverityFlag consume --prod-severity/--dev-severity flags. 2) src/config-loader.js: loadConfigFile reads nested config.prod and config.dev objects and applies validateRangeInt/validateAgainstList on prod.minAge/dev.minAge and prod.minSeverity/dev.minSeverity. 3) src/print-outdated.js and src/print-outdated-handlers.js: getDependencyType correctly determines 'prod' vs 'dev' based on package.json, and both table and JSON output include a “Type” column/field. 4) test/cli.config-file.test.js: verifies that config file nested prod/dev thresholds are read and apply correctly. 5) test/cli.flags.test.js: verifies fallback of general flags (--min-age, --severity) to both prod and dev thresholds. 6) test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js: confirms dependency type detection and output indication for prod vs dev dependencies. 7) test/printOutdated.json.test.js: confirms JSON summary.thresholds include separate prod/dev thresholds when passed via programmatic options. 8) Validation: parseIntegerFlag and parseStringFlag exit with code 2 on invalid prod/dev threshold values, and config-loader exits on invalid config values.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 007.0 have been fully implemented: CLI flags and config file support for prod/dev thresholds; dependency‐type detection; fallback to general flags; default behavior; input validation; and output indication (Type column/field). The existing comprehensive tests cover config-file scenarios, default/general flag fallback, programmatic threshold overrides, and dependency‐type output, confirming correct behavior.
